 19818                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19819                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19820                                  ;
 19821                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19822                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19823                                  ;
 19824                                  ; Inputs : None
 19825                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19826                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19827                                  ;	   free memory.
 19828                                  ;
 19829                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19830                                  ;
 19831                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19832                                  	
 19833                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19834                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:09A2h)
 19835                                  
 19836                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19837                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19838 000008E2 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19839 000008E5 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19840 000008E7 CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 19841 000008E9 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19842 000008EB CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 19843                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19844                                  	; ds = cs
 19845                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 19846                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 19847 000008ED A3[6803]                	mov	[area],ax
 19848 000008F0 A3[6403]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19849 000008F3 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 19850                                  				
 19851                                  	; include msbio.cl6
 19852                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19853                                  DOSLOMSG:

 19860                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 19861                                  ;
 19862                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 19863                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 19864                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 19865                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 19866                                  ;
 19867                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19868

 19875                                  	;retn

 19880                                  	;push	cs

 19887

 19889                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 19890

 19892                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem

 19918                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19919                                  ;
 19920                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.

 19922                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19923                                  ;
 19924                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19925                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19926                                  ; 
 19927                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19928                                  
 19929                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 19940                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19941                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19942                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19943                                  	; ds = cs

 19945                                  ;else
 19946                                  ;	..

 19995                                  	;xor	di,di
 19996                                  	
 19997                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20344                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20345                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20346                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20347                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20348                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20349                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20350                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20351                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20352                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20353                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20354                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20355                                  ;
 20356                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20357                                  
 20358                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20359                                  update_arena:
 20360 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20361 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20362 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20363 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20364                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20365                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20366                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20367                                  	; ds = cs 
 20368 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20369 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20370 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20371                                  						;  before sysvar
 20372 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20373                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20374 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20375 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20376 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20377                                  
 20378                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20379 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20380 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20381 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20382 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20383 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20384                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20385 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20386                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20387 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20388 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20389                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20390 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20391 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20392                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20393                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20394 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20395 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 20396 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 20397 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 20398 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20399 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 20400                                  ;
 20401                                  ; M012 : END

 20422                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20423                                  ;
 20424                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20425                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20426                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20427                                  ;
 20428                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20429                                  ;
 20430                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20432                                  AllocHMA:

 20434                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20435                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20436                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20437                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 20591                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20592                                  ;
 20593                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20594                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20595                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20596                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20597                                  ;
 20598                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20599                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20600                                  ;
 20601                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20602                                  
 20603                                  StartVDHead:
 20604                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20605                                  
 20606 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20607 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20608 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20609 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20610 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20611                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20612 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20613                                  VDiskSig1:
 20614 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20615                                  
 20616                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20617                                  
 20618 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20619                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20620 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20621 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20622 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20623                                  VDInt19:
 20624 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20625                                  OldVDInt19:
 20626 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20627                                  
 20628                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20629                                  
 20630                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20631 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20632                                  VDiskSig2:
 20633 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20634                                  
 20635                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20636                                  
 20637 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20638 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20639 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20640 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20641 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20642 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20643 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20644 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20645 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20646 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20647 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20648 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20649 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20650                                  
 20651                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20654                                  ;
 20655                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20656                                  ;
 20657                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20658                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20659                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20660                                  ;
 20661                                  ; Inputs : None
 20662                                  ;
 20663                                  ; Outputs : None
 20664                                  ;
 20665                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20666                                  ;
 20667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20668                                  
 20669                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20670                                  
 20671                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20672 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20673 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20674                                  
 20675                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20676                                  
 20677                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20678 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20679                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20680 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20681 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20682                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20683 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20684                                  
 20685                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20686                                  
 20687 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20688                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20689                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20690 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20691 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20692                                  
 20693                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20694                                  
 20695 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20696 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20697                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20698 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20699                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20700 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20701 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20702 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20703                                  
 20704                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20705                                  
 20706 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20707                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20708 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20709 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20710                                  
 20711                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20712                                  
 20713                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20714 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20715 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20716 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20717 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20718 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20719 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20720 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20721 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20722                                  
 20723                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20724                                  
 20725                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20726 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20727 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20728                                  
 20729                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20730                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20731                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20732 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20733                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20734 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20735                                  
 20736 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20737                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20738 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20739 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead

 20741

 20743 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20744

 20791                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20792                                  
 20793                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20794                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20795                                  
 20796                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20797                                  
 20798                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20799                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20800                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20801                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20802                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20803                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20804                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20805                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20806                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20807                                  ;								      ;I070
 20808                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20809                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20810                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20811                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20812                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20813                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070

 20861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20862                                  ;
 20863                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20864                                  ;
 20865                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20866                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20867                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20868                                  ;		the offset.
 20869                                  ;
 20870                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20871                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20872                                  ;
 20873                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20880                                  	;

 20882 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20883                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20885                                  	;

 20887 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20888 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20889 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20890 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20891 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20892                                  	;
 20893                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20894                                  	;push	ds
 20895                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20896                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h

 20902                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20903 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 20904 00000C15 C3                      	retn

 20909                                  ;
 20910                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20911                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 20914                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared

 20946                                  ;
 20947                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20948                                  ;
 20949                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20950                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20951                                  ;
 20952                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20953                                  
 20954                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20955                                  CPMHack:
 20956 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20957 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20958 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20959                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20960                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20961 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20962 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20963 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20964 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20965                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20966 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20967 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20968 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20969 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20970 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 21073                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21074                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21075                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to

 21109                                  
 21110                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21111                                  
 21112                                  fooset_zero:

 21210                                  ; This procedure is called after the config.sys has been processed and

 21872                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21873                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21874                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21875                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21876                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21877                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21878                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21879                                  ;
 21880                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21881                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21882                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21883                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21884                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21885                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21886                                  ;
 21887                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21888                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21889                                  ;
 21890                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21891                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21892                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21893                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21894                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21895                                  ;
 21896                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21897                                  ;
 21898                                  ;			  none.
 21899                                  
 21900                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21901                                  ;
 21902                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21903                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21904                                  
 21905                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21906                                  
 21907 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax
 21908 00000FE6 53                      	push	bx

 21913 00000FEB BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21914 00000FEE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21915 00000FEF 42                      	inc	dx

 22108                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22109                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22110                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22111                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22112                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22113                                  ;
 22114                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22115                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22116                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22117                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22118                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22119                                  ; program).
 22120                                  
 22121                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22122                                  
 22123                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22124                                  
 22125 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22126                                  
 22127                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22128                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22129                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22130                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22131                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22132                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22133                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22134                                  ; carridge return.
 22135                                  
 22136                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22137                                  ;character after =.
 22138                                  
 22139 000010CE 06                      	push	es
 22140 000010CF 1E                      	push	ds
 22141 000010D0 07                      	pop	es
 22142 000010D1 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22143 000010D2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22144

 22282                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22283                                  ;
 22284                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22285                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22288                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22289                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22290                                  
 22291                                  ParaRound:
 22292 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22293 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22294 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22295 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22296 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22297 00001156 C3                      	retn

 22299                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22300                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22301                                  ;
 22302                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22303                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22304                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22305                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22306                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22307                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22308                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22309                                  ;
 22310                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22311                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22312                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22313                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22314                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22315                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22316                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22317                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22318                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22319                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22320                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22321                                  ;
 22322                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22323                                  
 22324                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22325                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22326                                  sysinit_base:				
 22327 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22328 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22329 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22330 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22331 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22332 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22333 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22334 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22335                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22336                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22337 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22338 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22339 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22340                                  
 22341                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22342                                  
 22343 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22344 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22345 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22346                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22347                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22348                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22349 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22350                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22351 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22352                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22353                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22354                                  
 22355                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22356                                  stall:
 22357                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22358                                  _stall: 
 22359                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22360 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22361                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22362                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22363 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22364                                  
 22365                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22366 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22367                                  
 22368                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22369                                  
 22370                                  sum_up:
 22371                                  
 22372                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22373                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22374                                  ;
 22375                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22376                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22377                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22378                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22379                                  ;
 22380                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22381                                  
 22382 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22383                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22384                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22385 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22386                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22387                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22388 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22389 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22390 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22391 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22392                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22393 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22394 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22395                                  sum1:
 22396 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22397 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22398 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22399 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22400                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22401                                  sum_sys_code:
 22402                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22403 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22404                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22405                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22406                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22407                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22408                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22409                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22410                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22411 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22412 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22413 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22414                                  sum2:
 22415 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22416 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22417 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22418 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22419 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22420 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22421                                  
 22422                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22423                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22424                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22425                                  
 22426                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22427                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22428 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0

 22431 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0

 22446                                  ; Set_Buffer

 22448                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22449                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22450                                  ;
 22451                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.

 22521                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22522                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22523                                  ;
 22524                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22525                                  ;
 22526                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22527                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 22531                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22532 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22533 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22534 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]

 22536                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22537 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22538                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22539                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22540                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22541 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22542 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22543 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h

 22547 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22548

 22550                                  	; 05/09/2023

 22552 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22553                                  	; zf=1
 22554

 22585 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22586                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22587 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22588                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22589 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22590 0000127E C3                      	retn
 22591                                  
 22592                                  ; ======================================================================
 22593                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22594                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22595                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22596                                  
 22597                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22598                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22599                                  ;
 22600                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22601                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22602                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22603                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22604                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22605                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22606                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22607                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22608                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22609                                  ;
 22610                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22611                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22612                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22613                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22614                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22615                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22616                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22617                                  ;	conditions:
 22618                                  ;
 22619                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22620                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22621                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22622                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22623                                  ;
 22624                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22625                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22626                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22627                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22628                                  ;
 22629                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22630                                  ;
 22631                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22632                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22633                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22634                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22635                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22636                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22637                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22638                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22639                                  ;
 22640                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22641                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22642                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22643                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22644                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22645                                  ;
 22646                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22647                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22648                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22649                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22650                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22651                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22652                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22653                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22654                                  ;
 22655                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22656                                  
 22657                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22658                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22659                                  
 22660                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22661                                  stackinit:
 22662 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22663 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22664 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22665 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22666 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22667 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22668 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22669 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22670 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22671                                  
 22672                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22673                                  
 22674                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22675                                  	; ds = cs
 22676 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22677 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22678                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22679                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22680                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22681 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22682                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22683 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22684 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22685                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22686 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22687                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22688                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22689                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22690 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22691                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22692 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22693 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22694                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22695                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22696                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22697 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22698                                  
 22699                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22700                                  
 22701                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22702                                  
 22703                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22704                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22705                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22706 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22707                                  
 22708                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22709                                  
 22710 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22711                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22712                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22713                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22714 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22715 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22716 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22717 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22718 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22719                                  
 22720                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22721                                  
 22722 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22723 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22724 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22725 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22726 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22727 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22728 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22729                                  
 22730                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22731                                  
 22732 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22733 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22734 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22735                                  
 22736 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22737                                  
 22738                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22739                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22740                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22741                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22742                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22743                                  
 22744                                  buildloop:
 22745                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22746                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22747                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22748                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22749                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22750 000012D9 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22751 000012DD 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22752                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22753 000012E1 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax

 22755 000012E5 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22756                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22757 000012E9 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 22759                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22760 000012F1 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22761 000012F4 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22762                                  
 22763 000012F7 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop

 22765 000012F9 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8

 22767 00001300 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp

 22776 0000130F 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22777

 22779 00001313 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22780                                  
 22781                                  skip_disablenmis:

 23499                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23500                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23501                                  
 23502                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23503                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23504                                  
 23505                                  new_init_loop:
 23506                                  
 23507                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23508                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23509                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23510                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23511                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23512                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23513                                  
 23514 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23515 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23516 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23517 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23518                                  
 23519 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23520                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23521                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23522                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23523 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23524 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23525 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23526 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23527 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23528 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23529 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23530                                  
 23531 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23532 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23533 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23534                                  
 23535                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23536                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23537                                  
 23538                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23539                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23540                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23541                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23542                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23543                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23544                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23545                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23546                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23547                                  
 23548                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23549                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23550                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23551                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23552                                  
 23553                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23554                                  
 23555                                  setdevmark:
 23556                                  
 23557                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23558                                  	;push	es
 23559                                  	;push	cx
 23560                                  
 23561 00001498 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23562 0000149D 2E890E[BB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23563 000014A2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23564                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23565                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23566 000014A4 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23567 000014A8 41                      	inc	cx
 23568                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23569 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23570                                  
 23571                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23572                                  	;pop	cx
 23573                                  	;pop	es
 23574                                  	
 23575 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23576 000014B3 C3                      	retn

 23777                                  
 23778                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23779                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23780                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23781                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23782                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23783                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23784                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23785                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23786                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23787                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23788                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23789                                  
 23790                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23791                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23792 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23793 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23794 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23795                                  endstruc
 23796
