 23799                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23800                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23801                                  
 23802                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23803                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23804                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23805                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23806                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23807                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23808                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23809                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23810                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23811                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23812                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23814                                  
 23815                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23816                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23817 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23818 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23819 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23820                                  endstruc
 23821                                  
 23822                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23823                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23824                                  ;
 23825                                  ;
 23826                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23827                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23828                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23829                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23830                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23831                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23832                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23833                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23834                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23835                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23836                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23837                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23838                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23839                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23840                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23841                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23842                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23843                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23844                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23845                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23846                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23847                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23848                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23849                                  ;	   :
 23850                                  ;
 23851                                  ;Note:
 23852                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23853                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23854                                  ;
 23855                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23856                                  ;
 23857                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23858                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23859                                  ;
 23860                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23861                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23862                                  ;
 23863                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23864                                  ;
 23865                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23866                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23867                                  ;
 23868                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23869                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23870                                  ;
 23871                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23872                                  ;
 23873                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23874                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23875                                  ;
 23876                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23877                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23878                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23879                                  ;
 23880                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23881                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23882                                  ;
 23883                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23884                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23885                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23886                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23887                                  
 23888                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23889                                  
 23890                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23891                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23892                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23893                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23894                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23895                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23896                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23897                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23898                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23899                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23900                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23901                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23902                                  
 23903                                  ;**** Function flags
 23904                                  
 23905                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23906                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23907                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23908                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23909                                  
 23910                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23911                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23912 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23913 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23914 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23915 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23916 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23917 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23918                                  endstruc
 23919                                  
 23920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23921                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23922                                  ;
 23923                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23924                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23925                                  ;	     +-
 23926                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23927                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23928                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23929                                  ;	     |	:
 23930                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23931                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23932                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23933                                  ;	     |	:
 23934                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23935                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23936                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23937                                  ;	     +-	:
 23938                                  ;
 23939                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23940                                  ;
 23941                                  ;Note:
 23942                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23943                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23946                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23947                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23948                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23949                                  
 23950                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23951                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23952                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23953                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23954                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23955                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23956                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23957                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23958                                  
 23959                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23960 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23961 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23962 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23963 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23964 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23965                                  endstruc
 23966                                  
 23967                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23968                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23969                                  ;
 23970                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23971                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23972                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23973                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23974                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23975                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23976                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23977                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23978                                  ;
 23979                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23980                                  ;
 23981                                  ;            +-
 23982                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23983                                  ;	    | or
 23984                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23985                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23986                                  ;	    | or
 23987                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23988                                  ;	    | or
 23989                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23990                                  ;	    | or
 23991                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23992                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23993                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23994                                  ;	    | or
 23995                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23996                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23997                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23998                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23999                                  ;	    +-
 24000                                  ;
 24001                                  ;
 24002                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24003                                  ;      list.
 24004                                  ;
 24005                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24006                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24007                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24008                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24009                                  
 24010                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24011                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24012 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24013 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24014 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24015 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24016                                  endstruc
 24017

 24020

 24023                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24024                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24025                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24026                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24027                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24028                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24029                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24030                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24031                                  
 24032                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 24033                                  
 24034                                  ;**** Return code
 24035                                  ;
 24036                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 24037                                  
 24038                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 24039                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24040                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24041                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24042                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24043                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24044                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24045                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24046                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24047                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24061 000014D0 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 24062                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 24063                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 24064

 24067                                  _$P_Neg		   equ	02h	      ;AN000; Negative value

 24071                                  _$P_Extra	   equ	20h	      ;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 24072                                  _$P_SW		   equ	40h	      ;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 24073                                  _$P_Signed	   equ	80h	      ;AN000; signed numeric specified
 24074

 24076                                  _$P_time12am	   equ	01h	      ;AN038; set when AM is specified on time
 24077                                  _$P_TIME_AGAIN	   equ	02h	      ;AN039; SET WHEN READY TO RE-PARSE TIME
 24078                                  
 24079 000014D2 0000                    _$P_SaveSI_Cmpx:   dw	0		;AN000; save si for later use by complex

 24129                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 24131                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24132                                  
 24133                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24134                                  ; SysParse;
 24135                                  ;
 24136                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24137                                  ;
 24138                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24139                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24140                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24141                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24142                                  ;
 24143                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24144                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24145                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24146                                  ;
 24147                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24148                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24149                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24150                                  ;
 24151                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24152                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24153                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24154                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24155                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24156                                  ;
 24157                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24158                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24159                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24160                                  ;
 24161                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24162                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24163                                  ;
 24164                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24165                                  ;
 24166                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24167                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24168                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24169                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24170                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24171                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24172                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24173                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24174                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24175                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24176                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24177                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24178                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24179                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24180                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24181                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24182                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24183                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24184                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24185                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24186                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24187                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24188                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24189                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24190                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24191                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24192                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24193                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24194                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24195                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24196                                  
 24197                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24200                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24201                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24202                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24203                                  
 24204                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24205                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24206                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24207                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24208                                  ;
 24209                                  
 24210                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24211                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24212                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24213                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24214                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24215                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24216                                  
 24217                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24218                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24219                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24220                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24221                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24222                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24223                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24224                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24225                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24226                                  
 24227                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24228                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24229                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24230                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24231                                  ;	     segment.
 24232                                  
 24233                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24234                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24235                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24236                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24237                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24238                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24239                                  
 24240                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24241                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24242                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24243                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24244                                  
 24245                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24246                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24247                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24248                                  
 24249                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24250                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24251                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 24252                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 24253                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24254                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24255                                  
 24256                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24257                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24258                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24259                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24260                                  
 24261                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 24262                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 24263                                  
 24264                                  ;	     The code and PSDATA.INC have been aligned for ease of reading.
 24265

 24830                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24831                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24832                                  ;
 24833                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24834                                  ;
 24835                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24836                                  ;	    AL = type
 24837                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24838                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24839                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24840                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24841                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24842                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24843                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer

 25069                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25070                                  ;
 25071                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25072                                  ;
 25073                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25074                                  ;
 25075                                  ; Output:   None

 25080                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 25081 000018A8 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25082 000018A9 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25083                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 25084 000018AA 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25085 000018AD 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25086 000018AF 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25087                                  
 25088 000018B1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25089 000018B3 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25090

 25092 000018BA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25093                                  
 25094 000018BC 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 25095 000018C0 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25096                                  
 25097                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25098 000018C2 E81204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25099 000018C5 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 25100

 25102                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;

 25105

 25113                                  ;

 25247                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25248                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25249                                  ;
 25250                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25251                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25252                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25253                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25254                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25255                                  ;
 25256                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25257                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25258                                  ;
 25259                                  ; Output:    None
 25260                                  ;
 25261                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25262                                  ;
 25263                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25264                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25265                                  
 25266                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25267                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25268                                  
 25269                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25270                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25271                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here

 25273 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25274 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25275                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023

 25277 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25278 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25279                                  
 25280 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25281 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25282                                  
 25283 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25284                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 25286                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25287 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25288 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25289 0000194D C3                      	retn

 25550                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25551                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25552                                  ;
 25553                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25554                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25555                                  ;
 25556                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25557                                  ;
 25558                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25559                                  ;
 25560                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25561                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25562                                  
 25563                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25564                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25565 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25566 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25567 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25568                                  
 25569 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25570 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25571                                  
 25572                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25573 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25574 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25575                                  
 25576 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25577 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25578                                  
 25579                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25580 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25581 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25987                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF

 25997                                  	;lea	bx,[_$P_FileSp_Char] 	; "[]|<>+=;\"" at
 25998                                  					; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1838h
 25999                                  	; 07/09/2023

 26002                                  _$P_FileSp_Loop: 			;AN000;
 26003 00001BCB 2E3A07                  	cmp	al,[cs:bx]		;AN000; is it one of special character ?
 26004 00001BCE 7404                    	je	short _$P_FileSp_Exit	;AN000;
 26005                                  
 26006 00001BD0 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26007 00001BD1 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_FileSp_Loop		;AN000;
 26008                                  
 26009 00001BD3 41                      	inc	cx			;AN000; reset ZF
 26010                                  _$P_FileSp_Exit: 			;AN000;
 26011 00001BD4 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26012 00001BD5 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26013 00001BD6 C3                      	retn

 26020                                  ; _$P_Drive_Format;
 26021                                  ;
 26022                                  ; Function:  Check if the input string is valid drive only format.
 26023                                  ;	     And set the result buffer.
 26024                                  ;
 26025                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26026                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 26027                                  ;
 26028                                  ; Output:    None
 26029                                  ;

 26031                                  ;

 26035                                  _$P_Drive_Format:

 26043 00001BE3 722A                    	jc	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;

 26047

 26049                                  	;test	byte [es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag],_$P_Ig_Colon ;AN000; colon can be ignored?
 26050                                  	; 12/12/2022

 26052                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)	
 26053                                  	;test	word [es:bx],_$P_Ig_Colon
 26054 00001BF0 741D                    	jz	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;
 26055                                  
 26056 00001BF2 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; "d", 0  ?

 26063

 26066

 26068 00001C05 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; set

 26070                                  	;mov	al,_$P_Drive		;AN000; buffer
 26071                                  	; 08/07/2023

 26073                                  					      ; set result buffer

 26076

 26114 00001C2A 74ED                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop ;AN000; if no, loop
 26115

 26121 00001C34 C3                      	retn
 26122                                  
 26123                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 26124                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 26125                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26126                                  	; cf=0
 26127                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26128                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 26129

 26201                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26202                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26203                                  ;
 26204                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26205                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26206                                  ;	    blanks.
 26207                                  ;
 26208                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26209                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26210                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26211                                  ;
 26212                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26213                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26214                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26215                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26216                                  
 26217                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26218                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26219                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26220                                  
 26221                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26222 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26223 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26224 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26225                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26226                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26227 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26228 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26229 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26230                                  
 26231 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26232 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26233                                  
 26234 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26235 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26236                                  
 26237                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26238                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26239                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26240                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26241                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26242                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26243                                  %if 0
 26244                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26245                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26246                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26247                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26248                                  
 26249                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26250                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26251                                  
 26252                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26253                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26254                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26255                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26256                                  %endif
 26257                                  
 26258                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26259 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26260                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26261 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26262                                  
 26263                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26264 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26265                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26266 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26267                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26268                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26269                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26270                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26271 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26272                                  
 26273 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26274                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26275 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26276 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26277 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26278                                  
 26279 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26280                                  
 26281                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26282                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26283                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26284                                  	; cx=0 here
 26285 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26286                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26287                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26288 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26289 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26290 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26291                                  
 26292                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26293 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26294 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26295 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26296                                  
 26297 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26298                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26299                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26300 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26301 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26303                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26304                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26305                                  ;
 26306                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26307                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26308                                  ;
 26309                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26310                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26311                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26312                                  ;
 26313                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26314                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26315                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26316                                  
 26317                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26318                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26319                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26320                                  ;
 26321                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26322                                  
 26323                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26324                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26325                                  
 26326                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26327                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26328                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26329                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26330 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26331                                  
 26332                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26333 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26334 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26335                                  
 26336                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26337 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26338 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26339                                  
 26340 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26341                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26342                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26343 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26344                                  
 26345                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26346                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26347                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26348                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26349                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26350                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26351                                  
 26352                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26353                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26354 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26355 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26356                                  
 26357 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26358                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26359                                  
 26360                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26361                                  	; cf=0
 26362                                  	;retn
 26363                                  
 26364                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26365                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26366                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26367 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26368                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26369                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26370 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26371                                  
 26372                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26373                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26374                                  ;
 26375                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26376                                  ;
 26377                                  ;  Input:
 26378                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26379                                  ;
 26380                                  ;  Output:
 26381                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26382                                  ;
 26383                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26384                                  ;
 26385                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26386                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26387                                  
 26388                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26389 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26390 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26391 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26392                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26393                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26394                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26395 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26396 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26397 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26398 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26399 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26400 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26401 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26402 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26403 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26404 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26405                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26406                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;

 26408 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26409 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26410                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26411 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26412 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26413 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26414 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26415 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26416 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26417 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26418 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26419 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26420 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26421                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26422 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26423 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26424                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26425                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26426                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment

 26429                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;

 26432 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;

 26440 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26441                                  					;AN000; get next vector

 26474 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer

 26477                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation

 26480 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 26481                                  .size:
 26482                                  endstruc

 26487 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 26488 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26489 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26490                                  .size:
 26491                                  endstruc

 27018                                  
 27019                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27020                                  ;
 27021                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27022                                  ;
 27023                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27024                                  ;
 27025                                  ;   Modification log:
 27026                                  ;
 27027                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27028                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27029                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27030                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27031                                  ;
 27032                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27033                                  ;
 27034                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27035                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27036                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27037                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27038                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27039                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27040                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27041                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27042                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27043                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27044                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27045                                  ;
 27046                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27047                                  
 27048                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27049                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27050                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27051                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27052                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27053                                  
 27054                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27055                                  
 27056                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27057                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27058                                  
 27059                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27060                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27061                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27062                                  
 27063                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27064                                  ;
 27065                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27066                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27067                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27068                                  ;	           line.
 27069                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27070                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27071                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27072                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27073                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27074                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27075                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27076                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27077                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27078                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27079                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27080                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27081                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27082                                  ;	           for details).
 27083                                  
 27084 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27085 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27086 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27087 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27088 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27089 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27090 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27091 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27092 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27093                                  
 27094                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27095                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27096                                  
 27097                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27098                                  
 27099                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27100

 27112 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27113 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27114 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27115 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 27119                                  ;

 27121 00001F6D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 27122 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 27135 00001F7F 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)

 27149                                  
 27150                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27151                                  
 27152                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27153                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27154                                  
 27155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27156                                  ;
 27157                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27158                                  ;
 27159                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27160                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27161                                  ;
 27162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27163                                  
 27164                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27165                                  doconf:
 27166 00001F91 0E                      	push	cs
 27167 00001F92 1F                      	pop	ds
 27168                                  
 27169 00001F93 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27170                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27171 00001F96 CD21                    	int	21h
 27172 00001F98 8816[3A46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27173                                  
 27174                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27175                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27176                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27177                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27178 00001F9C 8816[3846]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27179                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27180                                  
 27181 00001FA0 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 27182 00001FA3 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27183                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 27184 00001FA6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27185 00001FA7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27186 00001FA9 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27187                                  
 27188                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27189                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27190                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27191 00001FAB E8F418                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27192                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27193                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27194 00001FAE C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27195 00001FB3 C3                      	retn
 27196                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27197 00001FB4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27198 00001FB6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27199 00001FB8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27200                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27201 00001FBA B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27202 00001FBD CD21                    	int	21h
 27203 00001FBF A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27204                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27205 00001FC2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27206                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27207                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27208                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27209                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27210                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27211                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27212 00001FC4 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27213 00001FC7 CD21                    	int	21h
 27214                                  
 27215                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27216 00001FC9 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27217                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27218                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27219                                  
 27220 00001FCD A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27221 00001FD0 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27222 00001FD3 E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27223 00001FD6 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27224                                  
 27225                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27226                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27227                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27228                                  ;
 27229                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27230                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27231                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27232                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27233                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27234                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27235                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27236                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27237                                  ;
 27238 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27239 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27240 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27241                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27242                                  
 27243 00001FDF 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27244                                  	
 27245                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27246 00001FE2 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27247 00001FE6 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27248                                  	
 27249                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27250                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27251                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27252                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27253                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27254                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27255                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27256                                  
 27257                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27258                                  	; ds = cs
 27259 00001FEA 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27260                                  	
 27261 00001FEE 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27262 00001FF0 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27263                                  
 27264 00001FF2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27265                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27266                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27267 00001FF4 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27268                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27269 00001FF6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27270 00001FF7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27271 00001FF9 9C                      	pushf
 27272                                  
 27273                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27274                                  
 27275 00001FFA 50                      	push	ax
 27276 00001FFB 57                      	push	di
 27277 00001FFC 51                      	push	cx
 27278 00001FFD B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27279 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27280 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27281 00002003 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27282 00002005 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27283                                  
 27284                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27285                                  
 27286 00002007 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27287                                  
 27288                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27289                                  
 27290                                  puteol:
 27291 00002008 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27292 0000200A AA                      	stosb
 27293 0000200B B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27294 0000200D AA                      	stosb
 27295 0000200E 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27296                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27297                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27298                                  
 27299                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27300                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27301 00002010 0E                      	push	cs
 27302 00002011 1F                      	pop	ds
 27303                                  
 27304 00002012 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count

 27407 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27408 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27409 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27410 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27411 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
