 27414                                  ;
 27415                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27416                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27417                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27418                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27419                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27420                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27421                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27422                                  ;   spot.
 27423                                  ;
 27424                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27425                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27426                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27427                                  ;   retrieved.
 27428                                  ;

 27624                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27625                                  ; buffer command
 27626                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27627                                  
 27628                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27629                                  ;									      *
 27630                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27631                                  ;									      *
 27632                                  ; input :								      *
 27633                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27634                                  ; output:								      *
 27635                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27636                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27637                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27638                                  ;									      *
 27639                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27640                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27641                                  ; logic:								      *
 27642                                  ; {									      *
 27643                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27644                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27645                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27646                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27647                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27648                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27649                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27650                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27651                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27652                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27653                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27654                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27655                                  ;	};								      *
 27656                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27657                                  ; };									      *
 27658                                  ;									      *
 27659                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27660                                  
 27661                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27662                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27663                                  tryb:
 27664 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27665 00002155 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27666                                  
 27667                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27668                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27669                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27670                                  ;%if 0
 27671                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27672 00002157 E83F1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27673 0000215A 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27674                                  ;endif
 27675                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27676                                  
 27677                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27678                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27679 0000215C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27680                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27681 0000215E 880E[6D1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27682                                  
 27683 00002162 BF[261D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27684                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27685                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27686                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27687                                  do7:
 27688 00002165 E87C07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27689 00002168 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27690                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27691                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27692                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27693                                  ;sr7:
 27694                                  	;jmp	coff
 27695                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27696 0000216A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27697                                  if7:
 27698 0000216D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27699 00002170 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27700                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27701 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27702                                  	;jne	short if11
 27703                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27704 00002178 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27705                                  
 27706                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27707                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27708                                  if11:
 27709                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27710 0000217A A1[731D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]

 27713

 27715                                  	;jmp	short en11
 27716                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27717 00002185 EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 27718                                  if13:
 27719 00002187 A3[6B1D]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax
 27720                                  en11:
 27721 0000218A EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 27722                                  en7:
 27723 0000218C 833E[691D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 27724 00002191 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 27725                                  
 27726                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 27727                                  ;	jne	short if18
 27728                                  
 27729 00002193 E87907                  	call	badparm_p
 27730 00002196 C706[6B1D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 27731 0000219C EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27732                                  if18:
 27733 0000219E A1[691D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 27734 000021A1 A3[9902]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 27735                                  
 27736 000021A4 A1[6B1D]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]
 27737 000021A7 A3[9B02]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax
 27738                                  
 27739                                  ;	mov	al,[p_buffer_slash_x]	; M016
 27740                                  ;	mov	[buffer_slash_x],al
 27741                                  
 27742 000021AA A1[AF02]                	mov	ax,[linecount]

 27744                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27750                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27751                                  ; break command
 27752                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27753                                  
 27754                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27755                                  ;									    *
 27756                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27757                                  ;									    *
 27758                                  ; input :								    *
 27759                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27760                                  ; output:								    *
 27761                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27762                                  ;									    *
 27763                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27764                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27765                                  ; logic:								    *
 27766                                  ; {									    *
 27767                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27768                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27769                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27770                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27771                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *

 29165                                  ; files command
 29166                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29167                                  
 29168                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29169                                  ; function: parse the parameters of files= command.			      *
 29170                                  ;									      *
 29171                                  ; input :								      *
 29172                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 29173                                  ; output:								      *
 29174                                  ;	variable files set.						      *
 29175                                  ;									      *
 29176                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 29177                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 29178                                  ; logic:								      *
 29179                                  ; {									      *
 29180                                  ;	set di points to files_parms;					      *

 29363                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29364                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29365                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29366                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29367                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29368                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29369                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29370                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29371                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29372                                  
 29373                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29374                                  ;									  *
 29375                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29376                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29377                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29378                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29379                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29380                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29381                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29382                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29383                                  ; input :								  *
 29384                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29385                                  ; output:								  *
 29386                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29387                                  ;									  *
 29388                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29389                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29390                                  ; logic:								  *
 29391                                  ; {									  *
 29392                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29393                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29394                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29395                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29396                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29397                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29398                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29399                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29400                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29401                                  ;	     }								  *
 29402                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29403                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29404                                  ;	};								  *
 29405                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29406                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29407                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29408                                  ; };									  *
 29409                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30523                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30524                                  ;
 30525                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30526                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30527                                  ;
 30528                                  ;	Output : none
 30529                                  ;
 30530                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30531                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30532                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30533                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30534                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30535                                  ;
 30536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30537                                  
 30538                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30539                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30540                                  	; ds = cs
 30541 00002989 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]

 30543                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30544 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30545 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30546                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30547                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30548                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30549                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30550                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30551                                  	; ds = cs
 30552 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30553 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30554 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30555                                  lim_set:
 30556                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30557                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30558                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30559                                  ;limx:
 30560                                  	;retn
 30561                                  	
 30562                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30563                                  
 30564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30565                                  ;
 30566                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30567                                  ;
 30568                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30569                                  ;	Output : none
 30570                                  ;
 30571                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30572                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30573                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30574                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30575                                  ;
 30576                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30577                                  
 30578                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30579                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30580 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30581 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30582 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30583 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30584 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30585 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30586 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30587 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30588 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30589 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30590                                  ;limx:
 30591 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30592                                  
 30593                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30594                                  ;
 30595                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30596                                  ;
 30597                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30598                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30599                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30600                                  ;
 30601                                  ;	Output : none
 30602                                  ;
 30603                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30604                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30605                                  ;
 30606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30607                                  
 30608                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30609                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30610                                  	; ds = cs
 30611 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30612                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30613                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30614                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30615 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30616                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30617 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30618 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30619                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30620                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30621 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 30622                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30623 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30624 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30625 000029CE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30626 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30627                                  timx:
 30628 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 30684                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30685                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30686                                  
 30687                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30688                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30690                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30691                                  
 30692                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30693                                  ;
 30694                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30695                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30696                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30697                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30698                                  ;
 30699                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30700                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30701                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30702                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30703                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30704                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30705                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30706                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30707                                  ; available during the load.
 30708                                  ;
 30709                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30710                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30711                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30712                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30713                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30714                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30715                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30716                                  ;
 30717                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30718                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30719                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30720                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30721                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30722                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30723                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30724                                  ;
 30725                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30726                                  
 30727                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30728                                  
 30729                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30730                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30731                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30732                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30733                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30734                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30735                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30736                                  
 30737                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30738                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30739                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30740                                  
 30741                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30742                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30743                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30744                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30745                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30746                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30747                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30748                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30749                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30750                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30751                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30752                                  
 30753                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30754                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30755                                  
 30756                                  InitVar:
 30757                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30758                                  	; ds = cs
 30759                                  
 30760                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30761                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30762                                  	;push	ax
 30763                                  	;push	cx
 30764                                  	;push	di
 30765 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30766                                  
 30767                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30768 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 30769 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30770                                  
 30771 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30772                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30773                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30774                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30775                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30776                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30777                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30778                                  
 30779                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30780                                  	; ds = cs
 30781 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30782 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30783 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30784 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30785                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30786 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30787                                  
 30788 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 30789                                  
 30790 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30791 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30792 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30793

 30795                                  	; 01/01/2033

 30798 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30799                                  
 30800                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30801                                  
 30802                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30803 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 30804                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30805                                  	;pop	di
 30806                                  	;pop	cx
 30807                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30808                                  
 30809 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 30810                                  
 30811                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30812                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30814                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30815                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30816                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30817                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30818                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30819                                  
 30820                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30821                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30822                                  FixMem:
 30823                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30824                                  	;push	ax
 30825                                  	;push	bx
 30826                                  	;push	cx
 30827                                  	;push	dx
 30828 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30829                                  
 30830 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30831                                  
 30832 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30833 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30834                                  
 30835 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30836                                  
 30837                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30838                                  
 30839 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30840 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30841 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30842                                  
 30843                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30844                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30845                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30846                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30847                                  
 30848 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30849 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30850 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30851 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30852                                  
 30853                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30854                                  
 30855 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30856 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30857 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30858                                  
 30859 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30860                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30861                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30862 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30863 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30864                                  
 30865                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30866                                  
 30867 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30868 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30869                                  
 30870 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30871 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30872 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30873 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30874                                  
 30875                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30876 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30877 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30878                                  fmX:	
 30879 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30880                                  
 30881 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30882                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30883                                  	;pop	dx
 30884                                  	;pop	cx
 30885                                  	;pop	bx
 30886                                  	;pop	ax
 30887                                  
 30888 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30889                                  
 30890                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30891                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30892                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30893                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30894                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30895                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30896                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30897                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30898                                  
 30899                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30900                                  fm_link:
 30901 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30902 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30903                                  
 30904                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30905                                  	;
 30906                                  	;push	es
 30907                                  	;push	cs
 30908                                  	;pop	es
 30909                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30910                                  	;pop	es
 30911                                  	
 30912                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30913                                  	; ds = cs
 30914                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30915 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30916                                  
 30917 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30918 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30919 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30920 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 30921                                  
 30922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30923                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30925                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30926                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30927                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30928                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30930                                  
 30931                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30932                                  fm_unlink:
 30933 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30934                                  	
 30935                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30936                                  	;
 30937                                  	;push	ds
 30938                                  	;push	cs
 30939                                  	;pop	ds
 30940                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30941                                  	;pop	ds
 30942                                  	
 30943                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30944                                  	; ds = cs
 30945                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30946 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30947                                  
 30948 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30949 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30950 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 30951                                  
 30952                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30953                                  
 30954                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30955                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30956                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30957                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30958                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30959                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30960                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30961                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30962                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30963                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30964                                  ;
 30965                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30966                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30967                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30968                                  ;
 30969                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30970                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30971                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30972                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30973                                  ;
 30974                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30975                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30976                                  ;
 30977                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30978                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30979                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30980                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30981                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30982                                  ;     lh
 30983                                  ;     /l
 30984                                  ;     1
 30985                                  ;     1000
 30986                                  ;     2
 30987                                  ;     print
 30988                                  ;     /d
 30989                                  ;     :lpt2
 30990                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30991                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30992                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30993                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30994                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30995                                  ; for:
 30996                                  ;    Each /L
 30997                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30998                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30999                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31000                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31001                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31002                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31003                                  
 31004                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31005                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31006                                  
 31007                                  ParseVar:
 31008                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31009                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31010                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31011 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 31012 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 31013                                  
 31014 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31015 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31016 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 31017                                  
 31018                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31019                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31020                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31021                                  
 31022 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31023 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31024 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31025                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31026 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31027 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31028                                  
 31029 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31030 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31031 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31032                                  
 31033 00002AA2 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31034                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31035 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31036                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31037 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31038 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31039                                  
 31040                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31041 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31042                                  
 31043                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31044                                  	;
 31045                                  	;push	es
 31046                                  	;push	cs
 31047                                  	;pop	es
 31048                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31049                                  	;pop	es
 31050                                  
 31051 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31052                                  
 31053 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31054                                  
 31055                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31056 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31057 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31058                                  
 31059                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31060 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31061                                  
 31062 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31063 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31064                                  
 31065 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31066 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31067                                  
 31068                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31069 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31070 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31071 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 31072 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 31073                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31074 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 31075 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31076                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31077                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31078 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 31079                                  
 31080                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31081                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31082                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31083                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31084                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31085                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31086                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31087                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31088                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31089                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31090                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31091                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31092                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31093                                  
 31094                                  parseL:
 31095 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 31096 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31097 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31098                                  
 31099                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31100                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31101                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31102                                  
 31103 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31104 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31105 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31106                                  
 31107 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31108 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31109 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31110                                  
 31111                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31112 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31113                                  
 31114 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 31115 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31116 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31117                                  
 31118 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31119 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31120                                  
 31121 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31122 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31123                                  
 31124                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31125 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31126 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31127                                  
 31128 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31129 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31130                                  
 31131                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31132                                  
 31133 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31134 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31135                                  
 31136 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31137                                  
 31138 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31139                                  
 31140                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31141 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31142                                  
 31143 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 31144 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31145 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31146                                  
 31147 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31148 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31149                                  
 31150 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31151 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31152                                  
 31153                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31154 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31155 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31156                                  plE1:	
 31157                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31158 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31159 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 31160 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 31161 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 31162                                  
 31163                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31164 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice

 31202                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31203                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31204                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31205                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31206                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31207                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31208                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31209                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31210                                  
 31211                                  isEOL:

 31213 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31214 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31215 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31216 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31217                                  ieX:	
 31218 00002B39 C3                      	retn

 31224                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31225                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31226                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31229                                  isWhite:

 31231 00002B3C 7406                    	je	short iwX

 31233 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31234 00002B42 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31235                                  iwX:	
 31236 00002B44 C3                      	retn

 31289                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31290                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31291                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31292                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31293                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31294                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31295                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31296                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31297                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31298                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31299                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31300                                  
 31301                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31302                                  stowUMB:
 31303 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31304 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31305 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31306 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31307                                  su10:	
 31308                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31309                                  	;push	bx
 31310                                  	;push	di
 31311                                  	;push	si
 31312                                  	;push	ds
 31313                                  	;push	es
 31314                                  	;push	cs
 31315                                  	;pop	es
 31316                                  	;push	cs
 31317                                  	;pop	ds
 31318                                  
 31319                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31320                                  	; ds <> cs
 31321                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31322 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31323                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31324 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31325 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31326                                  
 31327                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31328                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31329                                  	;jne	short su20
 31330                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31331                                  su20:	
 31332 00002B6A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31333 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31334                                  
 31335                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31336                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31337                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31338                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31339 00002B6E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31340 00002B70 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31341 00002B72 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31342

 31344                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31345 00002B74 2E8687[2A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31346                                  
 31347                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31348                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31349                                  	;
 31350                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 31351                                  	
 31352                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31353 00002B79 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31354 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31355                                  su30:	
 31356                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31357                                  	;pop	es
 31358                                  	;pop	ds
 31359                                  	;pop	si
 31360                                  	;pop	di
 31361                                  	;pop	bx
 31362 00002B7C C3                      	retn
